newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan must honour IMF accord - president.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan must honour IMF accord - president.

text.p: Pakistani President Farooq Leghari said on Tuesday that the new caretaker government must fully implement a recent accord with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for the revival of a stalled $600 million standby loan.
He said in nationally televised speech that interim Prime Minister Meraj Khalid's government must restore the confidence of international institutions and markets in Pakistan.
"For this, the agreement reached with the IMF will have to be fully implemented," Leghari said.

Last week, the IMF announced it intended to disburse two delayed tranches, worth about $80 million each, of the $600 million standby loan after approving an economic stabilisation package put together by ousted prime minister Benazir Bhutto's government.
Leghari dismissed Bhutto and her government in the early morning hours on Tuesday, and named Khalid as caretaker prime minister ahead of general elections set for next February.

Pakistani and IMF officials expected to endorse technical changes to a draft letter of intent on Wednesday in pursuance of last week's accord. It would then have to be cleared by the caretaker government and IMF management before the IMF decision on whether to release the two delayed tranches of the loan.
